newsitem.title: FINLAND: Finland mulls 2008 bond launch in autumn - finmin.
newsitem.headline: Finland mulls 2008 bond launch in autumn - finmin.

text.p: Finland's finance ministry is planning to launch a new serial bond maturing in 2008 in the autumn, which would later become Finland's 10-year benchmark, a senior finance ministry official said on Thursday.
"We are considering it, but we have no made any decisions yet," the official said.
Finland's longest benchmark is now the 7.25 percent coupon serial bond maturing on April 18, 2006 -- a maturity of less than nine years.

The state's longest serial bond is the 8.25 percent coupon bond maturing in 2010, but it does not have benchmark status and the stock outstanding is only 3.77 billion markka, compared to tens of billions for each of benchmark serial bonds SUVS.
